source: TCU Graduate Catalog 2025-2026 - Kinesiology Department, Harris College of Nursing & Health Sciences

programs.name: Master of Science in Athletic Training
programs.accreditation: CAATE (Commission on Accreditation of Athletic Training Education)
programs.applicationDeadline: April 15 (cohort starts summer); applications open July 1

admissionRequirements.degree: Bachelor's degree from regionally accredited institution
admissionRequirements.gradeInPrereqs: C or better in all prerequisite courses
admissionRequirements.observationHours: 100 hours in athletic training setting under BOC ATC supervision (must be completed by first class day)
admissionRequirements.references: Two reference forms with letters addressing academic abilities, interpersonal skills, and AT potential

prerequisiteCourses.name: Biology I (with lab)
prerequisiteCourses.note: Science prereqs must include lab component

prerequisiteCourses.name: Chemistry I (with lab)
prerequisiteCourses.note: Science prereqs must include lab component

prerequisiteCourses.name: Physics I (with lab)
prerequisiteCourses.note: Science prereqs must include lab component

prerequisiteCourses.name: Anatomy and Physiology I (with lab)
prerequisiteCourses.note: Science prereqs must include lab component

prerequisiteCourses.name: Anatomy and Physiology II (with lab)
prerequisiteCourses.note: Science prereqs must include lab component

courses.name: General Medical Conditions and Applied Pharmacology
Organization and Administration in Athletic Training
Advanced Clinical Skills and Techniques in Athletic Training
Behavioral Health Concerns for the Athletic Trainer
Current Trends and Issues in Athletic Training

retentionPolicy.academicWarning: Cumulative GPA below 3.0 in any semester
retentionPolicy.dismissal: Failure to raise GPA to 3.0 by end of next enrolled semester; more than two grades of C+ or lower; any grade of F
retentionPolicy.maxCGrades: No more than two grades of C+ or lower may satisfy degree requirements
retentionPolicy.incompletePolicy: I grade must be removed within 60 days of next regular semester or converts to F
retentionPolicy.progressionWhileIncomplete: At discretion of Athletic Training Program Director

tcuEarlyAdmission.description: TCU undergraduate MOSC 3+2 students (MO32 BS) may apply directly via ATCAS. Must complete 110 hours of undergraduate courses and Movement Science degree requirements before beginning graduate coursework. Does not guarantee admission; students not admitted complete undergraduate degree in Movement Science.

programs.name: Master of Science in Kinesiology
programs.note: Includes 6 thesis hours; resource area and specialization hours vary by student

admissionRequirements.degree: BS or BA degree with 24-hour concentration in kinesiology or equivalent from accredited institution

curriculum.note: Courses emphasizing chosen concentration (biomechanics, exercise physiology, exercise psychology, motor control, nutrition, physical activity and chronic disease, or sport psychology)
Courses in related areas determined after review of student preparation and goals. Must have approval of advisor and department chair.

retentionPolicy.academicWarning: Cumulative GPA below 3.0 in any semester
retentionPolicy.dismissal: Failure to raise GPA to 3.0 by end of next enrolled semester; grade of F
retentionPolicy.maxCGrades: No more than two grades of C or C+ may satisfy degree requirements
retentionPolicy.acceptableGrades: C or higher; grade of F results in immediate dismissal

generalGradPolicies.transferCredit: Up to 6 semester hours typically accepted; must carry at least B grade (3.0); must be residence credit (not extension or correspondence); must be applicable to degree program as determined by advisor
generalGradPolicies.additionalMastersDegree: Up to 9 hours from prior master's may apply; all applied courses must carry B or better; non-thesis credits only; all credits must be earned within 5 years of matriculation
generalGradPolicies.acceleratedPrograms: Up to 12 credit hours at 55000 and 60000 level may count toward both undergraduate and graduate degrees in approved 4+1 programs
generalGradPolicies.timeLimitMasters: 5 years from earliest credit to be counted on degree (including transfer credit)
generalGradPolicies.thesisRequirement: Minimum 6 hours thesis registration; must register at least 1 hour per fall/spring semester while working with committee or using university facilities
generalGradPolicies.admissionToCandidacy: Prepared by dean's office after 9+ hours completed and all admission conditions met
generalGradPolicies.intentToGraduate: Must file at beginning of semester of planned graduation
